Following all presentations after Session I there will be ample
opportunity for discussion by all participants, the total number
of which is expected to be approximately 75.
Since the objective of the Conference, being held under a contract
from the U. S. Office of Education and Title VII of the National
Defense Education Act, is a publication, copies of the documents
to be read, or spoken from, should be available by September 8,
for press and stenotypist uses. Formal presentations are asked
to be limited to from ten to fifteen minutes except for Session
VI, in which case eight to ten minute presentations are expected
because of the larger number of reports to be presented*
Any materials which can be distributed in advance will be partic¬
ularly welcomed, and the copies of the remarks left for publication
may be somewhat longer than the oral presentation, and may include
graphic or tabular materials not conveniently presented at the
Conference itself. Slide projectors will be available.
No central hotel reservations have been made for this conference
and participants are urged to request needed accommodations
directly as soon as possible.
Under terms of the contract, the NAEB is prepared to reimburse
speakers for travel and hotel expenses incurred.
HJS/dp
July 10, 1959
